title: Jerden's Art Page
content:
[[module CSS]]
.imagediv { float: right; margin: 15px}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .imagediv {
    float: none; text-align:center; margin: auto;
  }
}

div#header h1 a span {
    font-size: 0px;
}
div#header h1 a:before {
    content: "SCP Foundation";
    color: #eee;

}
div#header h2 span {
    font-size:0px;
    padding: 4px;
}
div#header h2:after {
    content: "You can put anything here";
    font-weight: bold;
    color: #f0f0c0;
    padding: 19px 0;
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 1px rgba(0, 0, 0, .8);
    white-space: pre;
}

#header {
  background-image: url(https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Rose-Cross.png);
  background-size: 90px;
}

[[/module]]
[[div class="content-panel centered standalone"]]
[[=]]
+* [[[jerden| Jerden's Articles]]] | [http://scp-int.wikidot.com/jerden Jerden's Translations]
++* Artwork Pages:
+++* [[[art:secure-facilities-locations| Foundation Facility Insignia]]] | [[[art:instalacoes-seguras| Lusophone Facility Insignia]]] 
+++* [[[art:locations-of-interest| Flags and Coats of Arms for Locations of Interest]]]
+++* [[[art:goc-logos| Global Occult Coalition Logos]]] | [[[art:goc-unit-insignia| Strike Teams and Assessment Teams]]]
+++* [[[art:doctors-of-the-church-hub| Doctors of the Church Heraldry]]]
[[/=]]
[[/div]]
[[>]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/>]]

This is an art page for my various vector graphics, although I'll admit it's more image editing than image creation. This was originally created for all the [[[art:secure-facilities-locations| Foundation Facility Insignia]]] I made, but I've now moved a lot of my work to seperate Artwork pages (linked above), so this page is basically for all my miscellaneous work. 

Since I've been asked about this before, I don't do commissions, but I do take requests (or volunteer myself!) to make icons for new additions to the [[[Secure Facilities Locations|Facilities Page]]] page, and I'd be up for doing other types of logo too. If you have something you think I could contribute to, I'll want to see a draft first, I like to know my work will actually be used on the wiki.

Feel free to use the various insignia I've made on other pages, or to use them as templates to create your own - the sections at the bottom of this page may help with that.

[[toc]]

+ [[[art:doctors-of-the-church-hub| Doctors of the Church Heraldry]]]

I created Coats of Arms and Flags for the various fictional nations featured on [[[doctors-of-the-church-hub| the new canon hub]]], including some extra logos that haven't made it onto the hub yet.

----

+ [[[art:goc-logos| Global Occult Coalition Logos]]]

The page is collaborative, but I put [[[art:goc-logos| this collection]]] together, and many of the logos on it were created by me.

----

+ [[[art:goc-unit-insignia| Global Occult Coalition Distinctive Unit Insignia]]]

I made so many Distinctive Unit Insignia for GO Assessment Teams and Strike Teams that I put them on [[[art:goc-unit-insignia| their own page]]] - I think it's some of my most creative work so far!

----

+ [[[Locations of Interest]]]

The art I made for this page is now showcased on a [[[art:locations-of-interest| Locations of Interest Artwork Page]]], but I have the map and the different Nexus/Freeport icons I made for it below.

++ [[[fragment:locations-map| Map of Locations of Interest]]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Show Map of Locations of Interest" hide="Hide Map"]]
[[include :scp-wiki:fragment:locations-map]]
A depiction of the locations of various inhabited anomalous locations in the SCP Universe. Follow [[[fragment:locations-map| the link]]] to the page it's hosted on for a full list of sources. 

[[module CSS]]
.legend-grid {
    display: grid;
    grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(min(90px, 100%), 1fr));
    grid-gap: 10px;
    box-sizing: border-box;
}

.legend-box {
    width:90px; 
    border: 1px solid white; 
}
[[/module]]
[[=]]

++* Area Classes
[[/=]]
[[div class="legend-grid"]]

[[div class="legend-box"]]
= [[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Briar.svg width="50px"]]
[[div class="legend-text"]]
= **##blue|Briar##**
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="legend-box"]]
= [[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Asphodel.svg width="50px"]]
[[div class="legend-text"]]
= **##green|Asphodel##**
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="legend-box"]]
= [[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Camelot.svg width="50px"]]
[[div class="legend-text"]]
= **##FFDD00|Camelot##** 
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="legend-box"]]
= [[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Shangri-La.svg width="50px"]]
[[div class="legend-text"]]
= **##orange|Shangri-La##**
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="legend-box"]]
= [[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Dunwich.svg width="50px"]]
[[div class="legend-text"]]
= **##red|Dunwich##**
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="legend-box"]]
= [[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Free-Port.svg width="50px"]]
[[div class="legend-text"]]
= **##purple|Free Port##**
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="legend-box"]]
= [[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Location-of-Interest.svg width="50px"]]
[[div class="legend-text"]]
= **Other Location of Interest**
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]

@@@@
+++ Area Class Symbols

For the various types of Nexus, made for the map shown above.

[[collapsible show="▷ Briar Class Nexus" hide="◁ Briar Class Nexus"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Briar.svg title="Briar." height="300px"]]
Blue Thorn.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Asphodel Class Nexus" hide="◁ Asphodel Class Nexus"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Asphodel.svg title="Asphodel." height="300px"]]
Green Flower.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Camelot Class Nexus" hide="◁ Camelot Class Nexus"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Camelot.svg title="Camelot." height="300px"]]
Yellow Castle.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Shangri-La Class Nexus" hide="◁ Shangri-La Class Nexus"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Shangri-La.svg title="Shangri-La." height="300px"]]
Orange Pagoda
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Dunwich Class Nexus" hide="◁ Dunwich Class Nexus"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Dunwich.svg title="Dunwich." height="300px"]]
Red Tentacles.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Free Port" hide="◁ Free Port"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Free-Port.svg title="Free Port." height="300px"]]
Purple Anchor
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Crossroads" hide="◁ Crossroads"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Crossroads.svg title="Crossroads." height="300px"]]
Nexus connects to one or alternate realities, so it's a Grey Crossroads. A class of my own invention, since this feels like the best way to describe locations like the Wanderer's Library.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Turing" hide="◁ Turing"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Turing.svg title="Turing." height="300px"]]
Nexus is located in digital space, so it's the Maxwellism Symbol in Blue. This was initially suggested as a hypothetical on the old [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/forum/t-1381116/nexus-series#post-3822629 Nexus Hub discusion page] by [[*user MaliceAforethought]], and was then added by [[*user LemonBee12]] to describe Cipher City.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Other Location of Interest" hide="◁ Other Location of Interest"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Location-of-Interest.svg title="Location of Interest." height="300px"]]
Generic "Location of Interest" Symbol. Used for everything without a specific area class.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

----

+ [[[Now, The Serpent]]]

Personal Insignia for characters from my tale series.

[[collapsible show="▷ White Crow" hide="◁ White Crow"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/now-the-serpent/White_Crow.png title="White Crow." height="300px"]]

Based on SunnyClockwork's representation of the [[[sunny-art-goi| Serpent's Hand]]] (The Serpent's Hand 1) and [https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Crow_with_stark_white_lines.svg a White Crow] - an allegorical depiction of my protagonist.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Zhang Wen" hide="◁ Zhang Wen"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/now-the-serpent/Zhang_Wen.png title="Zhang Wen." height="300px"]]

Made my own [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seal_(East_Asia) Chinese-Style Seal] for Zhang, the font is [https://fonts.google.com/specimen/ZCOOL+QingKe+HuangYou ZCOOL QingKe HuangYou] mostly just because I liked the way it looked. I've probably done something wrong, if you know any Chinese feel free to correct me.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Circe Atalanta Galanis" hide="◁ Circe Atalanta Galanis"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/now-the-serpent/Circe_Galanis.png title="Circe Atalanta Galanis." height="300px"]]

Inspired by the SCP Foundation symbol as well as by the [[[theme:maxwell-s-silver-hammer| Maxwellian logo and theme]]], the idea here is "lightning breaching containment". The numbers around the border are a transliteration of "Circe Atalanta Galanis" in binary.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Rahab" hide="◁ Rahab"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Leopard-Commando.png title="Leopard Commando." height="300px"]] [[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/now-the-serpent/Rahab.png title="Rahab." height="300px"]]

I doubt "Leopard Commando" ever had actual insignia in-universe, but if they did it would look something like this. Rahab would eventually get her own personal emblem, after she beat a silverback gorilla in hand-to-hand combat.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Morgan Loxley" hide="◁ Morgan Loxley"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/now-the-serpent/Morgan_Loxley.png title="Morgan Loxley." height="300px"]]

This isn't Loxley's family coat of arms, this would be something he came up with himself. The serpent is because he's literally a reptile working for the Serpent's Hand, the arrow is because he's just like Robin Hood!
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]
----

+ [[[Departments]]]

I never miss an opportunity to make another hub, I created this page to list the various departments with their own hubs or tags. While doing so, I realised some of the Departments lacked logos so I made them for the ones lacking them.

[[collapsible show="▷ Alchemy Department" hide="◁ Alchemy Department"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/alchemy-department.png title="Alchemy Department." height="300px" alt="Alchemy Department Logo"]]

I quickly put this together based on the Department icon template provided by [[[list-of-foundation-s-internal-departments | old departments page]]] and the alchemical symbol for the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alchemical_symbol Philosopher's Stone] - it fits the outline very well and I thought it would be the most recognisable as a symbol of alchemy.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Mythology and Folklore Department" hide="◁ Mythology and Folkore Department"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/folklore-dept.png title="Mythology and Folklore Department." height="300px"]]

I put this together based on the template provided by [[[list-of-foundation-s-internal-departments | old departments page]]] and the [https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Wolpertinger.png Wolpertinger] from [[[SCP-6193]]], I wanted a creature from folklore that fit well into the circular space.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Department of Other" hide="◁ Department of Other"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/department-of-other.svg title="Department of Other." height="300px"]]

Logo for the Department of Other, thanks to [[*user Rimple]] for feedback. I think it works well with the red and black color scheme, and there's a nice J in the Joker's smile.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Pataphysics Department (black and white)" hide="◁ Pataphysics Department (black and white)"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/pataphysics-department.png title="Pataphysics Department." height="300px"]]

I recoloured the Logo from the [[[theme:pataphysics| Pataphysics Theme]]] to make it consistent with the other images on the [[[departments|Departments page]]], credit to [[*user TSATPWTCOTTTADC]] for the original design.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

----

+ Groups of Interest

[[collapsible show="▷ Obscurrakorps Sigil" hide="◁ Obscurrakorps Sigil"]]
[[image Obscurra.svg title="Obscurrakorps Sigil." width="300px"]]
I feel a bit iffy on creating this because this blatantly Fascist symbol is clearly inspired by [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schutzstaffel SS iconography], but... well, it's not a swastika so you can probably get away with using it if you want to represent the Obskurrakorps. Based on an earlier design by LemmoLime, we put this together one evening on the Discord. Whatever you do, please don't remember me as the "Nazi Logo Guy"!
@@@@
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Zenith Group" hide="◁ Zenith Group"]]
[[image Zenith-Group.png title="Zenith Group" width="300px"]]
Killerpoyo's Zenith Group, member of the Council of 108 and backer of [[[valravn-corporation-hub| Valravn]]].
@@@@
[[/collapsible]]

----

+ [[[secure-facilities-locations| English Language Facilities ]]]

The insignia for English-Language Sites and Areas are now showcased on their [[[art:secure-facilities-locations| own art page]]].

++ [[[art:secure-facilities-locations| Secure Facility Insignia]]]

++ [[[fragment:facilities-map| Map of Foundation Facilities]]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Show Facilities Map" hide="Hide Map"]]
Made this with the help of [[*user L200]], follow [http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/fragment:facilities-map the link] to the page it's hosted on for a full list of Sources.
[[include :scp-wiki:fragment:facilities-map
legend = Legend|
site = Site|
area = Area
]]
[[/collapsible]]
@@ @@

----

+  [http://scp-int.wikidot.com/secure-facilities-locations International Facilities]

++ [[[fragment:facilities-map-int| Map of International Branches and Facilities]]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Show International Map" hide="Hide Map"]]
Made this with the help of [[*user L200]], follow [http://scp-int.wikidot.com/fragment:facilities-map the link] to the page it's hosted on for a full list of Sources since I didn't make all of these images, I just put them onto a map.
[[include :scp-wiki:fragment:facilities-map-int]]

@@ @@

[[module CSS]]
.legend-grid {
display: grid;
grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(min(100px, 100%), 1fr));
grid-gap: 10px;
box-sizing: border-box;
}

.legend-box {
width:100px;
border: 1px solid black;
border-radius: 0.5em;
}
[[/module]]
[[include :scp-wiki:fragment:facilities-map-int-legend]]
[[/collapsible]]
@@ @@

----
++ [http://scp-int.wikidot.com/instalacoes-seguras Lusophone Facilities]
The insignia for the Facilities of the Lusophone (Portugese-Speaking) Branch are now showcased on their [[[art:instalacoes-seguras| own art page]]].

[[[art:instalacoes-seguras| Lusophone Foundation Facilities Insignia]]]
----

++ Spanish Branch Sites
Sites using the same numbering system as the Parent Foundation:
[[collapsible show="▷ Site-34, Spanish Branch" hide="◁ Site-34, Spanish Branch"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Site-34.svg title="Site-34, Spanish Branch." width="300px"]]
Slight edit of a design HarryBlank already did, based on the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_the_Hispanic_People Flag of the Hispanic People]. I was told on the Spanish Discord that the tilde above the number improved it, the letter ñ is a distinctive feature of the Spanish language.
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Site-313, Balboa, Cauca, Columbia." hide="◁ Site-313, Balboa, Cauca, Columbia."]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Site-313.svg title="Site-313, Colombia." width="300px"]]
Made a logo for [http://scp-int.wikidot.com/expediente-de-instalacion-segura-sitio-313 Site-313] based on the  [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Colombia Flag of Colombia], with a crossed out eye in a shade of green taken from the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cauca_Department Flag of Cauca] - after all, they specialise in counter-concepts!
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

++ [http://scp-int.wikidot.com/i-57-hub Secure Facilities of the Facility-57 (I-57) Canon]

In the I-57 Canon, the Latin-American Regional Council refers to its Sites as Instalaciones, translated to Facilities (which means the canon gets called I-57 or F-57, in reference to the main facility in the canon). I made these based on existing line art by [[*user Dc_Yerko]] and [[*user Almarduk]], giving them their own unique border (from the I-57 logo on the hub) and a color scheme based on the country they're located in.
[[collapsible show="▷ Facility-9, Venezuela" hide="◁ Facility-9, Venezuela"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Facility-9.svg title="Facility-9, Venezuela" width="300px"]]
Background based on the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Venezuela Flag of Venezuela].
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Facility-13, Chile" hide="◁ Facility-13, Chile"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Facility-13.svg title="Facility-13, Chile" width="300px"]]
Colors based on the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Chile Flag of Chile] - a white star on  a blue background.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Facility-17, Kiribati" hide="◁ Facility-17, Kiribati"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Facility-17.svg title="Facility-17, Kiribati" width="300px"]]
Colors based on the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Kiribati Flag of Kirabati] - red, gold, white and blue.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Facility-20, Haiti" hide="◁ Facility-20, Haiti"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Facility-20.svg title="Facility-20, Haiti" width="300px"]]
Colors based on the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Haiti Flag of Haiti] - red, blue, white and green.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Facility-33, Chile" hide="◁ Facility-33, Chile"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Facility-33.svg title="Facility-33, Chile" width="300px"]]
Colors based on the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Chile Flag of Chile] - red, blue and white.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Facility-57, Chile/Argentina" hide="◁ Facility-57, Chile/Argentina"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Facility-57.svg title="Facility-57, Chile/Argentina" width="300px"]]
I-57 spans the border of Argentina and Chile, high in the Andes Mountains, so I took the red from the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Chile Flag of Chile] and the blue from the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Argentina Flag of Argentina].
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Facility-96, Falkland Islands" hide="◁ Facility-96, Falkland Islands"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Facility-96.svg title="Facility-96, Falkland Islands" width="300px"]]
For geopolitical reasons, I'm going to leave it deliberately ambiguous whether the colors chosen are a reference to the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_the_Falkland_Islands Flag of the Falkland Islands] or to the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Argentina Flag of Argentina].
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Facility-99, Mare Nubium, The Moon" hide="◁ Facility-99, Mare Nubium, The Moon"]]
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Facility-99.svg title="Facility-99, Mare Nubium, The Moon" width="300px"]]
Grey color scheme to match Area-32.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]
----

++ [http://scp-int.wikidot.com/secure-facilities-location-fr Secure Facilities of the French Branch]
The French Branch operates Facilities around the world, assigning each with a Hebrew Letter rather than a number. Based on the [http://o5command-int.wdfiles.com/local--files/tech-team:graphic-templates/scp-logo-fr-400.svg Francophone Logo] created by [[*user EstrellaYoshte]], to give them a distinctive outline on the map.
+++ Site Insignia
[[collapsible show="▷ Site-Aleph, Massif Central, France" hide="◁ Site-Aleph, Massif Central, France"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/site-FR-aleph.svg title="Site-Aleph, Massif Central, France" width="300px"]]
Based on the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_France Flag of France] with a golden mountain added to it, since the location of the Site is in the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massif_Central Massif Central] highlands.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Site-Beth, Lebanon, Middle East" hide="◁ Site-Beth, Lebanon, Middle East"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/site-FR-beth.svg title="Site-Aleph, Lebanon, Middle East" width="300px"]]
Based on the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Lebanon Flag of Lebanon].
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Site-Ghimel, Algeria, North Africa" hide="◁ Site-Ghimel, Algeria, North Africa"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/site-FR-ghimel.svg title="Site-Ghimel, Algeria, North Africa" width="300px"]]
The Site is in the Sahara Desert, so this is based on the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Algeria Flag of Algeria], with a sand colored. I imagine it being in the part of Algeria that the French used for nuclear testing (obviously not the exact same location, but the general region seems like a good place to hide some weird stuff without anyone noticing).
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Site-Mayim, Romandy, Switzerland" hide="◁ Site-Mayim, Romandy, Switzerland"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/site-FR-mayim.svg title="Site-Mayim, Romandy, Switzerland" width="300px"]]
Site-Mayim is an underground network beneath the French Speaking parts of [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Switzerland Switzerland]. 
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Site-Lamedh, Bourgogne-Franche-Comté, France" hide="◁ Site-Lamedh, Bourgogne-Franche-Comté, France"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/site-FR-lamedh.svg title="Site-Lamedh, Bourgogne-Franche-Comté, France" width="300px"]]
The radio telescope comes from the Site's [http://fondationscp.wikidot.com/installations-de-la-branche-francophone#lamedh image on the FR list], with the yellow rectangles on blue taken from the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Franche-Comt%C3%A9 Flag of Franche-Comté] due to it's location within that region of France.
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Site-Yod, Scotland, UK" hide="◁ Site-Yod, Scotland, UK"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/site-FR-yod.svg title="Site-Yod, Scotland, UK" width="300px"]]
Based on the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Scotland Flag of Scotland]. No real idea why there's a French Site in Scotland, but why not, I suppose?
@@ @@
[[/collapsible]]

+++ Area Insignia

----

+ Using the Insignia

If you'd like to use these anywhere, for anything, then you can. Just link back here when citing your sources, it'll be great for my ratings. Feel free to use the following code to edit the header (for default Sigma-9, Blankstyle and Black Highlighter, may not work for others).
[[collapsible show="▷ Show Code for changing Sigma-9 Header" hide="◁ Area-14 used as an example"]]
[[code]]
[[module CSS]]
.imagediv { float: right; margin: 15px}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .imagediv {
    float: none; text-align:center; margin: auto;
  }
}

div#header h1 a span {
    font-size: 0px;
}
div#header h1 a:before {
    content: "Area-14 Network";
    color: #eee;

}
div#header h2 span {
    font-size:0px;
    padding: 4px;
}
div#header h2:after {
    content: "Armed Biological Containment";
    font-weight: bold;
    color: #f0f0c0;
    padding: 19px 0;
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 1px rgba(0, 0, 0, .8);
    white-space: pre;
}

#header {
  background-image: url(https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Area-14.svg);
  background-size: 90px;
}
[[/module]]
[[/code]]
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="▷ Show Code for Blankstyle" hide="◁ Area-14 used as an example"]]
[[code]]
[[module CSS]]
:root{
  --header-title: "Area-14 Network";
  --header-subtitle: "Armed Biological Containment";
}

div#extra-div-1 {
    background-image: url(https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Area-14.svg);
    filter: opacity(20%);
}
[[/module]]
[[/code]]
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="▷ Show Code for changing Black Highlighter Header" hide="◁ Area-14 used as an example"]]
[[code]]
[[module CSS]]

:root {
    --logo-image: url("https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/Area-14.svg");
  background-size: 90px;
    --header-title: "            Area-14";
    --header-subtitle: "          Armed Biological Containment";
}

/* Adjust Mobile Image Size */
@media (max-width: 479px) {
#header {
    background-size: 100px 100px;
    background-position: 1em;
}
}
[[/module]]
[[/code]]
[[/collapsible]]

In case anyone's curious, I can imagine these existing in-universe, probably created by each Site and maybe used in a semi-official manner to help people keep track of which number is which. You can see this as a fun way to promote a sense of Site identity and solidarity while doing the Foundation's difficult but necessary work, or you can see it as a cynical ploy to promote a pseudo-nationalistic sense of unity. Or both. Up to you.

----

+ Making Your Own

I am happy to make Site or Area insignia for new additions to the Facilities page, but if you would like to try it for yourself, feel free to download and edit the various svg files - [https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/template-site.svg template-site] and [https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/jerden-insignia/template-area.svg template-area] have everything you need to get started, but you can just download and edit any existing logo to use that as the starting point. I created all of them in [https://inkscape.org/ Inkscape] (because it's free), but other image editing software will also work. You may need to also download the [https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Bungee Bungee] font for the text I use for the Facility insignia, but that's also free. 

I'd recommend converting any text into a "path" (if you keep it as text the font may not work in certain browsers) then uploading it to the web as an optimised (plain) svg file. This will give you better resolution than a png, with a much smaller file size (most of the time - if the svg file is larger, it's probably due to shapes or embedded images that can be simplified without any loss of resolution). As far as I'm aware, all browsers should render .svg files without issue, and it enables you to do a lot more with the image if you need it larger (or smaller). Good luck, and remember that all of your questions can usually be answered by Google, that's how I learned this stuff!

When designing these kind of insignia, whether for a character, group of interest, location or facility, I recommend that you follow the [https://nava.org/good-flag-bad-flag Principles of Good Flag design]:
# Keep It Simple.  Keep in mind the size you want it to be, and don't make it too complex.
# Use Meaningful Symbolism. The colors and symbols chosen should reflect the location, function, or ideally both.
# Use 2 or 3 Basic Colors. Limit yourself to a small number of colors.
# No Lettering or Seals.  You can make exceptions, but writing is usually unnecessary, and won't be readable at a smaller scale.
# Be Distinctive or Be Related.  Being related to a real-life flag is a good way to show connections, but you'll want your design to not be too similar to anything that already exists.

For further education/entertainment,  [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pnv5iKB2hl4 listen to the dulcet tones of Roman Mars]. 

Of course, I have broken all of these principles at one point or another while making these insignia, but generally the closer I stick to them the happier I am with the result - my favourite work on this page is generally the designs that were the easiest to do. That's not to say you can't create a more intricate design, just keep in mind the scale you want it to work at.
